section.name: Support
section.p: There a multiple channels from where support for Jolokia can be obtained. Bugs are tracked via GitHub, questions should be preferably posed in the Jolokia Forum. Thanks to ConSol* we are able to provide. proffesional support in various ways for Jolokia, too.

On the other hand, the are ways for supporting the development of Jolokia, too. You can contribute code and bug-fixes via GitHub (prefered) or with monetary support (donations via pledgie or flattring Jolokia).

subsection.name: Bug tracking
subsection.p: Jolokia uses GitHub's bug tracker for managing bugs and feature request.

subsection.name: Forum
subsection.p: A forum (kindly provided by Nabble) for Jolokia related discussions can be found here. Don't hesitate to put it under fire with your questions and suggestions.

subsection.name: Blog
subsection.p: We occassionally blog on http://labs.consol.de about various topics (1-2 posts per month). There are interesting use cases how to setup JSR-160 connectors for JBoss and Weblogic, what is the best way for configuring Nagios with check_jmx4perl but also about things like Java Mail mysteries. If you are interested in Jolokia stuff only, subscribe to the Jolokia RSS feed. Otherwise, with this RSS Feed you get them all (and from my co-workers as well).

subsection.name: Commercial Support
subsection.p: Thanks to my employer ConSol*, we are able to offer you professional support and consulting. I.e. we do (and already have done for jmx4perl with quite some success):

ul.li: Support with certain service level agreements, up to 7x24 support.

Workshops for evaluating how to best integrate Jolokia (and jmx4perl) in you server landscape. We are especially expert for large scale integration in large Nagios and OP5 setups, not only for monitoring JMX MBeans but for Nagios in general (see here and here for some work my collegues have done).
Consulting and custom programming, e.g. an agent manager for mass deployment of the agents to hundreds of servers.

subsection.p: Please contact me (either per mail at roland@jolokia.org or via our contact form) if you are interested in a concrete offering or for a reference.
So, that was it for the plug ;-)

subsection.name: Source
subsection.p: Jolokia uses GitHub as source repository. Send me pull requests for enhancing Jolokia featurewise or fixing some bugs. They will be considered all and potentially integrated after reviewinv. Please note, that all the contributed code must be licensable under Apache License, Version 2.
Jolokia source can be found online, the clone URL is git@github.com:rhuss/jolokia.git
Visit Jolokia and then ... fork it !

subsection.name: Your Support for Jolokia
subsection.p: Jolokia is free software, released under the business friendly Apache License. That's mostly because I believe that open source software is the real driving force behind software innovation and I highly appreciate the fine pieces of open source software engineering I had the luck to use in our daily work. I love this.
You should probably stop reading here at this point ;-)

Nevertheless, there's a way for financially supporting this project. I have been asked for this possibility. Donations will help keeping up the movivation for further enhancements of Jolokia (and to honor the past development which took some efforts). The motivation is high anyway, though.
There are two way: Either via a direct donation with Pledgie or via Flattr, which is a real new revolutionary way of give-and-take and much fun, too. Enough said, here are the buttons:
